pages.text: Assuming you've read the previous entry, here's some important information you'll want to remember.$(br2)Obviously, different wheats require different blocks. Gold wheat needs gold blocks, diamond seeds need diamond blocks and so on. By default, netherite scrap seeds need an ancient debris to convert.

Another important thing to know is that more valuable wheats have vastly lower conversion chances. This means that although it may take you a bit to get iron wheat seeds, diamond wheat seeds will require dozens more times waiting.$(br2)Just a single wheat trying to convert to a diamond wheat will take forever.

You might think that bonemealing your crops to force growths and in turn force an attempt to convert is a great idea, but it seems that wheats which are attempting to convert don't take very kindly to it.$(br2)When you bonemeal a wheat crop, the forced growth will have a lower chance to convert than normal growths.

But the nuances don't end there. If you harvest a fully grown resource wheat, the chance that it'll drop an extra seed is small, meaning it might take you lots of harvests before you have enough seeds to build a decently sized farm.$(br2)Don't worry though, there's techniques to combat these difficulties discussed in later chapters.
